The plant produces flat, pod-like seed pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Acacia truculenta is well adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitats.
